availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward Newton McCormick (Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer. Montgomery County, Kentucky, native. Son of John McCormick and Ruth McCormick. Married to Narcissa A. Bradshaw McCormick in Montgomery County, Kentucky, on August 28, 1855. Father of Thomas Marshall McCormick, and Edward N. McCormick. Attended school in Montgomery County in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Montgomery County in 1850. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, 57B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 49.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 214.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Country, p. 288B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994049, Montgomery County Marriages, p. 1.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Montgomery County, KY, October 1863, p. 104.
